brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to evaluate the efficacy of treatment of radial shockwave in
      myofascial pain syndrome in the lumbar region compared to placebo through questionnaires and
      imaging exams.

clinical_study.brief_title: Radial Extracorporeal Shock Wave Treatment (rESWT) of Myofascial Pain Syndrome in Low Back Pain

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Presenting clinical complaints of lumbar and / or gluteal pains for 3 months or more

          -  Display pain of moderate to severe intensity: visual analogue scale (VAS)> 4

          -  Diagnosis of myofascial pain syndrome in the lumbar and / or gluteal

          -  Authorize in writing the term of free and informed consent to participate in the
             study

          -  Availability of frequent attendance at hospital

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Organic or psychological disorders that contraindication participation of patients in
             study

          -  Metabolic, infectious, oncological or rheumatologic disorders

          -  Fibromyalgia

          -  Labor dispute

          -  Indication for surgery in column

          -  Contraindications to therapy of shock waves:

               -  Coagulopathy and / or anticoagulant

               -  Pregnancy

               -  Acute infection in soft tissue or bone

               -  Systemic Infections

               -  Presence of ulcers at treatment sites

               -  Presence of larger vessels or nerves at treatment sites

               -  Polyneuropathies

               -  Malignancies

               -  Cardiac arrhythmias or use of pacemaker

               -  Epilepsy

intervention.description: Radial Extracorporeal Shock Wave applicator use in 6 sessions with 1 week of interval, 1000 impulses per myofascial trigger point, 10 to 15 hertz frequency, 2 to 4 bar pressure
Placebo applicator, use in 6 sessions with 1 week of interval, 1000 impulses per myofascial trigger point, 10 to 15 hertz frequency, 2 to 4 bar pressure

facility.name: IOT HCFMUSP - Instituto de Ortopedia e Traumatologia do Hospital das Clínicas da Faculdade de Medicina da USP

clinical_study.official_title: Prospective, Comparative, Randomized Study of the Effectiveness of Shock Wave Treatment in Myofascial Pain Syndrome in Low Back Pain

overall_official.affiliation: IOT HCFMUSP - Instituto de Ortopedia e Traumatologia do Hospital das Clínicas da Faculdade de Medicina da USP

primary_outcome.description: The outcome will be assessed by Visual Analogue Scale (VAS)
primary_outcome.measure: Evidence of pain relief by visual analogue scale (VAS) of radial extracorporeal shock waves in myofascial pain syndrome in the lumbar and gluteal region compared to placebo
primary_outcome.time_frame: 6 weeks after the last session of shockwave results will be measured

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

responsible_party.investigator_title: Researcher and Collaborator of Pain Group

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Crossover Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Investigator), Primary Purpose: Treatment
